result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor Lovis Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered restitution in the amount of $8,000.00 to be paid to Radio Shack, joint and several with Trevante Young 15CF462, Bryan Sanders 15CF461 and C.H (aka AX).

Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 235 days time served.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years initial confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victims: Radio Shack,  Kristal S. and Co-actors: Trevante Young, Bryan Sanders, C.H. (aka AX).

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trevor Lovis Young in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Trevor Lovis Young in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.   

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 7 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 4 years with credit for 235 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims: Radio Shack,  Kristal S. and Co-actors: Trevante Young, Bryan Sanders, C.H. (aka AX).
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Court ordered restitution in the amount of $8,000.00 to be paid to Radio Shack, joint and several with Trevante Young 15CF462, Bryan Sanders 15CF461 and C.H (aka AX).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Trevor Lovis Young not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing /restitution hearing.  Parties requests new date.   Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Trevor Lovis Young not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing.  Parties requests new date.    Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Adjourn Sentencing filed.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Trevor Lovis Young not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Court in trial.   Case adjourned for sentencing/Restitution in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Trevor Lovis Young in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Trevor Lovis Young in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing/restitution in Branch 26.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case 14CM3304 dismissed and read-in to case 15CF463 for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Trevor Lovis Young not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-22-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Trevor Lovis Young not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court denied defense motion for modification of bail.  Case remains set for plea hearing on 5-18-15, 8:30 a.m.
Notice of Motion and Motion For Modification of Bail received and filed with court.
Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Trevor Lovis Young not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE HEARING SCHEDULED IN BRANCH 26.
Oral No Contact Order with Sarah D. and Fischberger Variety.

Defendant Trevor Lovis Young in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Trevor Lovis Young in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Court ordered the bail to remain the same with the addition of GPS monitoring.  Hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.   COURT WILL RETAIN FILE>

Attorney Michael Jude in court, Defendant Trevor Lovis Young not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Trevor Lovis Young in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Trevor Lovis Young in custody.  Ron Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Robert St.Onge-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing and  no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: KRISTAL S.; RADIO SHACK - 1844 S 15th St.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Trevor Lovis Young in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Trevor Lovis Young in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
